text:
Welcome to How To Cook That, i'm Ann Reardon 
and in this episode I'm going to share with you

a 100-year-old hot chocolate recipe that is 
literally the best homemade hot chocolate

I have ever tasted 😍 Now I don't say that 
lightly because I don't drink tea or coffee so

hot chocolate is the hot drink that I drink and 
I have tried so many recipes and not found any

of them great but this one is wonderful. I found 
this chocolate and cocoa recipe booklet from 1911

and this was actually a promotional recipe booklet 
that you used to be able to get for free when you

bought Walter Baker chocolate 100 years ago and 
in it is all sorts of recipes and information

about chocolate and the recipe for what it calls 
plain chocolate which is the amazing hot chocolate

recipe that I'm going to show you how to make. 
It says to mix one tablespoon of cornstarch

with one gil of milk. Now a gil is about 
100 mils so about that much that'll do

then add in the cornstarch or the corn flour 
and mix that until there are no more lumps.

It says to put the remainder of the milk 
in a pan and onto the heat. Now I've chosen

a really big pan here it looks like it's oversized 
for the job but you'll see why I did that

in a minute. Put that over a low heat and it 
says when the milk comes to boiling point stir

in the cornstarch. Now as you can see when milk 
boils it bubbles right up and that's why we've

got the big pan now tip in that cornstarch and 
stir it in and then it says to cook this for 10

minutes. Now don't skimp on this step because this 
is doing two things ... one you need a couple of

minutes to cook the cornstarch so it doesn't 
taste floury and two ... the remaining eight

minutes are evaporating off some of the water 
from the milk which leaves you with a richer

creamier hot chocolate. The recipe book talks 
about this hot chocolate as if it has magical

powers listen to this: it says it's a perfect food 
as wholesome as delicious a beneficent restorer of

exhausted power it's highly nourishing it's easily 
digested and is fitted to repair wasted strength,

preserve health and prolong life! Wow. It agrees 
with dry temperaments and convalescence with

mothers who nurse their children with those whose 
occupations oblige them to undergo severe mental

strains with public speakers and with all those 
who give work to a portion of the time needed for

sleep. It soothes both the stomach and the brain 
and for this reason as well as for others it's

the best friend of those who engage in literary 
pursuits. Amazing claims! Next we need two ounces

of Walter Baker's premium number one chocolate 
now Walter Baker had three different chocolates

on the market at the time you've got this german's 
sweet chocolate now Samuel German was one of the

employees at the cocoa mill back in 1819 and he 
came up with the idea of making chocolate with

not just cocoa beans and a little bit of sugar and 
some vanilla but also adding in some coffee beans.

Everyone liked it so Dr Baker bought the recipe 
off him and paid him 10 times his yearly salary

how generous is that! And then he also named the 
chocolate bar after him what a great boss how

lovely to have a generous payout for the recipe 
and a chocolate bar named after you. Then they had

this one which is a sweet chocolate, it has the 
trademark picture on the front. This is actually a

very old pastel painting from 1743 by Jean-Etienne 
Liotard, a famous artist of the time. He was

known for his portraits he even painted Marie 
Antoinette before she became the Queen of France.

No one is sure who the girl in this 
picture is serving the hot chocolate

some stories say she is Anna Baltauf who was the 
daughter of an impoverished knight. She actually

worked at the chocolate shops in Vienna and one 
day young Prince Dietrichstein met her fell in

love and married her and so the story goes he 
commissioned the famous artist to paint her

as he met her serving chocolate. No one knows 
for sure but we do know that the Walter Baker

company bought a copy of the painting to go on 
their cocoa packaging and their sweet chocolate.

This one is actually a white chocolate and white 
chocolate just has the cocoa fat from the cocoa

beans and not the cocoa powder, so if you break 
this down you get fat and cocoa powder they've

just taken the fat from it mixed it with some 
sugar and some vanilla. That's not what we want

in this recipe and then this one is their famous 
premium number one baker's chocolate named after

Dr Baker the original owner of the company. It 
has hardly any sugar in it it is the cocoa beans

ground up with a little bit of vanilla and that is 
what we want to use today. A third of people were

illiterate at this time so having very different 
coloured labels for the different chocolate

was important for telling them apart. In the shops 
you can just look for any dark chocolate that has

the highest percentage of cocoa solids that you 
can find. Next it says to have the chocolate cut

in fine bits and put it in a small iron or granite 
ware pan and add three tablespoons of sugar and

two tablespoons of hot water and place a pan over 
a hot fire and stir until smooth and glossy. I'm

gonna skip the pan and the fire and just microwave 
it for 15 seconds instead. Now you can see it

still looks grainy and that's okay that's just the 
sugar and that will dissolve in the hot milk all

we're trying to do here was melt the chocolate 
and mix it in with the water so it's easier to

combine with the milk. Now it says to add this 
to the hot milk and beat the mixture with a whisk

until it's frothy i love frothy hot chocolates 
and then it says serve at once. Look how good

that looks 😋 I'm gonna add some marshmallows and a 
sprinkle of extra chocolate and this is so yummy.

But you do need to take note of what it says in 
the book ... it says people who make constant

use of chocolate are the ones who enjoy the 
most steady health and are the least subject

to a multitude of little ailments which destroy 
the comfort of life. With thanks to my wonderful

patrons who support this channel you can join them 
here and if you want to get hold of my cookbook it

is here. If you like this series let the algorithm 
know by liking sharing commenting subscribing and

watching more make it a great week by being 
kind to others and i'll see you on Friday.
